position: Data Scientist @ABInBev | AAC '21 Finalist | IIT KGP '23

experience.title: Winner - Citi CIC Hackathon 4.0

experience.company: Kirloskar Institute of Advanced Management Studies

experience.title: B.R.E.W.-Data Scientist Intern
experience.description: • Duplicate GR Detection: Aligned with the business model to scope out the areas of payment leakages in the procurement process w.r.t. Goods Receipt (GR) creation.• Developed a multi-layer (NLP + Record Linkage) solution to identify the duplicate GRs in the system and followed up with a Machine Learning layer to reduce the False Positives.• Benefitted the organisation with a substantial annual EBITDA through my model to proactively capture duplicate GRs and avoid overpayments and repeat payments.
experience.description_html: • Duplicate GR Detection: Aligned with the business model to scope out the areas of payment leakages in the procurement process w.r.t. Goods Receipt (GR) creation.• Developed a multi-layer (NLP + Record Linkage) solution to identify the duplicate GRs in the system and followed up with a Machine Learning layer to reduce the False Positives.• Benefitted the organisation with a substantial annual EBITDA through my model to proactively capture duplicate GRs and avoid overpayments and repeat payments.

experience.title: Finalist - Adobe Analytics Challenge 2021
experience.description: • Secured the 4th place in the Global Intercollegiate Finals of the Adobe Analytics Challenge out of 4000+ teams from 22 countries. The only Indian team to make it to the grand finale. Awarded with 3000 USD.• Analyzed The Walt Disney Company’s business data across 2 platforms: Disney Web and Disney App on Adobe Analytics Workspace to answer the key business questions of the challenge.• Business solutions included redesigning the website, executing separate business strategies for different customer bases and introducing new features to increase Disney’s annual revenue.• Engineered customer segmentation based on several characteristics to understand the needs of different people and connect with Disney’s customer base.
experience.description_html: • Secured the 4th place in the Global Intercollegiate Finals of the Adobe Analytics Challenge out of 4000+ teams from 22 countries. The only Indian team to make it to the grand finale. Awarded with 3000 USD.• Analyzed The Walt Disney Company’s business data across 2 platforms: Disney Web and Disney App on Adobe Analytics Workspace to answer the key business questions of the challenge.• Business solutions included redesigning the website, executing separate business strategies for different customer bases and introducing new features to increase Disney’s annual revenue.• Engineered customer segmentation based on several characteristics to understand the needs of different people and connect with Disney’s customer base.

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: • Green Book Project: Analyzed travel pattern of black people all across the globe through their social media posts• Collected about 50k tweets containing one or more of 16 hashtags in total, analyzed individual and non-individual accounts separately, using M3 multimodal deep neural architecture for identification of individuals/organizations• Hierarchical topic modelling of tweets year wise, both unsupervised and supervised by various algorithms to understand the motivation and purpose of tweets. Final result used Correlation Explanation for topic modelling
experience.description_html: • Green Book Project: Analyzed travel pattern of black people all across the globe through their social media posts• Collected about 50k tweets containing one or more of 16 hashtags in total, analyzed individual and non-individual accounts separately, using M3 multimodal deep neural architecture for identification of individuals/organizations• Hierarchical topic modelling of tweets year wise, both unsupervised and supervised by various algorithms to understand the motivation and purpose of tweets. Final result used Correlation Explanation for topic modelling

experience.title: National Winner - Maverick 2.0 Hackathon
experience.description: • National Winner of ABInBev’s Maverick 2.0 Hack-a-thon among 750+ teams all across India. The only team of sophomores to make it to the final. Awarded with a cash prize of INR 1 lac.• Built a recommendation system for cross sell and upsell of ABInBev’s products. Used Neural Collaborative Filtering for building the recommendation system. LSTM model was used to recommend quantities for the same.• Separate strategies were implemented for cross sell and upsell which aim to increase the net generation revenue.• Built a Graphical User Interface using Flask to showcase and present our model.• GitHub link:

Awarded with a cash prize of INR 1 lac.• Built a recommendation system for cross sell and upsell of ABInBev’s products. Used Neural Collaborative Filtering for building the recommendation system. LSTM model was used to recommend quantities for the same.• Separate strategies were implemented for cross sell and upsell which aim to increase the net generation revenue.• Built a Graphical User Interface using Flask to showcase and present our model.• GitHub link:

experience.title: Undergraduate Researcher
experience.description: SemEval 2021 Task 7: Humor and Offense Detection and Rating. Used bi-LSTM layers on top of BERT features for humor detection and rating. Paper published at ACL-IJCNLP 2021 conference, Thailand.
